titleStmt.title: Raising Children in the Past
TUNOCENT Dataset
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 31647

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

media.desc: The informant has not explicitly agreed to the publication of the audio recording. Thus, the audio recording is available only to the research project itself.

monogr.title: The Arabic Dialect of Testour (Northwestern Tunisia): A phonological and morphological analysis

biblStruct.note: The town of Testour lies close to the Medjerda river in northwestern Tunisia and it was founded in the 17th century by the Muslim Moriscan community who was exiled from Spain, after the Reconquista led to a rise in Christian zeal in the Iberian peninsula. By making North Africa their new home, the Moriscos introduced their customs, agriculture, architecture, food and dress amongst many other things, to these new towns and to the locals. The inhabitants of Testour today claim that they are the descendants of the Moriscos, and as such as keen to practice typical Moriscan trades, such as producing the chéchia hat and celebrating the Maʔlūf music. This master’s thesis aims at documenting some of the phonological and morphological features of the Arabic dialect of the present community of Testour, on which to my knowledge, no such linguistic works currently exists. The recordings on which this thesis is based have been collected during the framework of the TUNOCENT project hosted by the University of Vienna, which strives to collect and document the dialects of certain towns in northwestern and central Tunisia. The outcome of this thesis is to put Testour on the linguistic map of Tunisia, a country on which relatively very little has been done in this regard, as well as to hopefully contribute a better insight on the ambiguous dialectal classifications in Tunisia.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the TUNOCENT teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the arche prefix are pointers to resources archived in the long-term repository ARCHE.
Private URIs using the assets prefix are pointers to assets used by the TUNOCENT web application.
Private URIs using the datatypes.vicav.fl prefix are pointers to feature lists.
Private URIs using the datatypes.vicav.st prefix are pointers to VICAV sample texts.
Private URIs using the datatypes.tunocent.ums prefix are pointers to transcribed texts of unmonitored speech.
Private URIs using the datatypes.tunocent.pp prefix are pointers to TUNOCENT place profiles.

spanGrp.span: Now...
Tell me in general how life was before and what has changed and...
Life was good before
Women would not go out, let me tell you.
Women would not go out
And the man would run the errands, he would not let the woman go out.
The man would be the one who brings, he would bring the meat, the groceries, he would bring anything
And the woman would cook
She would wash the clothes, she would sew
She would iron
She would make wheat at home, she would knead (the bread), she would wash
She would do everything
She would raise the children
The children would behave well, and they would stay in their place
And they would fear and respect (their elders), and they would eat whatever was available
And if their mum tells them "Be quiet", they would be quiet
And in the evening they would sleep, they would not go out in the street.
She would help them study, she would gather them in the room and help them with their homework
They would not go out, they would be fearful
(She would tell them), "Wash your feet", and they would wash their feet, "don’t talk like this", they wouldn’t talk like that
"Go to sleep", and they would sleep.
Nowadays it’s not like that, now everything has changed.
Before, the woman would wash clothes in the washing basin with her hands from one o’clock until nine o’clock in the evening, and she would do like this /mimics the washing process by hand/
And she would not say "I’m tired!" and she wouldn’t say a thing like that
Nowadays (they complain) "I’m tired! My shoulder is hurting, my chest is hurting, I have headache!" What is causing you the pain?
We did not cook..., we used to cook with the kerosen stove /mimics the sound of the stove/
Now they have the gas cooker
We used to cook over firewood, and knead the bread with our hands, we kneaded the bread with our hands.
Nowadays, it’s not like this anymore, my dear.
People used to be fearful and timid and they would not speak
And the children were educated properly

And regarding the teacher; you would take care of the teacher (you would behave well), of your master, your master would say "Do that!" your master would say "Don’t speak!" your master would tell you "Don’t..."
Nowadays, do they still fear their headmaster or their teacher? Nowadays, they no longer fear neither the headmaster nor the teacher.
There is no respect
No, this is all because of the parents.
No, parents are not raising their children right, I always say this.
The parents, when their child goes out of the house, they no longer care about him
They do not guide him. They do not tell him "my son, do not do so and so"
"If you meet an old person, tell him good morning"
"If you meet an old woman accompany her to her place"
"And if she is carrying a basket, tell her give it to me, I will carry it for you."
Nowadays no, nowadays it’s not like this.

His mother leaves him and goes out. And her child would begin to act out, he disturbs things, spits, and destroys, he would begin to yell and scream and the mother would just talk to her neighbour as if everything is normal.
She does not tell him "Why did you talk?" or "Why did you scream?" or "Be quiet!" None of this, no, no, no, no, no, no.
She doesn’t say to her son "That’s bad! Shut up, don’t speak like this, it’s shameful!"
No, his mother sees what he’s doing and would tell you "What did he do to you? He’s just a child."
No, what kind of child is this?
There are children and there are adults.
Isn't it so? And there’s respect and honour.
"No, it’s okay." No, it’s not okay, no.
It’s a matter of upbringing. Nowadays, those poor children that you find around, those are all victims of their parents
It’s not their fault
These poor children that you find all around, the youth that are running around, they are all victims of their parents.
Most of them (end up like this) because of their mother. The father eats and leaves, he goes to work.
But the mum is at home and if her son is late she doesn’t ask him "Why are you late?"
If he spits , she does not ask "Why did you spit?"
If he was away and tore his clothes she doesn’t ask him why the clothes are torn
If he touches something, she doesn’t ask him "Why have you touched this?"
The mother starts building a wall between her and her son.
